page.title: 18Bonchurch Village and Pond
page.content: At{Bonchurch Village}there is a shop called{'The Pond'.}It is a post office and a general store. Bonchurch is famous for its writers like{Charles {Dickens}who stayed at The Winterbourne Hotel, and a writer called{Swinburn who stayed at East Dean. There are 100 steps to Upper Bonchurch. Most of the houses are semi-detached, and some are very pretty. There is a book shop in Bonchurch. The owner is Mrs Wolfenden, as well as owning the bookshop, she has written four books, the fifth one is in print.There is a beautiful pond. It is 133 metres long and 25 metres wide. It is surrounded by trees on one side and a stone wall on the other. In the pond there were some mallard ducks and some baby moorhens. There are many water creatures in the pond.
